action.action-desc: Mr. Miller of Florida (for himself and Mrs. Walorski) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to clarify that the estate of a deceased veteran may receive certain accrued benefits upon the death of the veteran, and for other purposes.

section.header: Clarification of eligible recipients of certain accrued benefits upon death of beneficiary

subsection.text: Section 5121(a)(2) of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by inserting , or estate, after person; and
by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.text: The estate of the veteran (unless the estate will escheat).

subsection.text: The amendment made by subsection (a) shall apply with respect to the death of an individual on or after the date of the enactment of this Act.

subsection.header: Relief of estate of Shelton Hickerson
subsection.text: Notwithstanding section 5121 of title 38, United States Code, the Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall pay to the estate of Shelton Hickerson, formerly of Indianapolis, Indiana, the sum of $377,342, representing the amount that the Secretary awarded to Shelton Hickerson on the date of his death but was not payable to any survivor or the estate of Shelton Hickerson.
